div.head: Richard Smoot. Will.
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. I Richard Smoot of Charles County in the
province of Maryland being weake of body but of perfect memory have made and
ordained this my last will and testament in manner and form following
I commit my soule to God that gave it and my body to the ground to be buried in
Christian buriel.

It. I give and beqeauth unto my eldest sonn Richard Smoot that plantation
that I am dwelling upon when he shall come to the full age of one and
twenty years.

It. I give and bequeath unto my Edward Smoot the new plantation
Called Smoot Purchase containing one hundred acres of land be it near or
left when he shall come to the full age of one and twenty years to have and to
hold the same to him & his heirs fore ever.

It. I give and bequeath all the rest of my goods and chattles after that my debts are
paid to be eaequally divided between my five children that is to say Richard my
Eldest sunn Edward and Elizabeth William and Elonor are to have and equall
share of all my goods and well within doores are without.

It. I make constitute ordaine and appooint my loving Brothers William Barton and
Robert Rowlands overseers of this my last will and testament in witness hereof
I have hereunto set my hand and seale the 23rd day of April in the year of our
Lord God one thousand six hundred seventy and six.

Witnesses
Henry Henly
his
William Browne
marke
his
Richard R Smoot
mark

that the line against the crop margin added by the
appointment of the above Richard as his absolute will
Witness
Matthew Hill
Matter >Davis

Oct. 31st 1676 then was the within writing proved to be signed sealed and
published by Richard Smoot as his last will and testament by the oaths of
Will Browne and Matter Davis witnesses to the same before me
3 3/4 sides
Benjamin Rozer
